intro: Comesperma aristulosum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hakea, is a flowering plant native to south-western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces bright yellow flowers in late winter to early spring, which are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. The species is well adapted to the dry, sandy soils of its native habitat and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas.
